content:
That's great to hear! It's always a relief when you find a good cobbler who can breathe new life into your favorite shoes.

Since you've already had a positive experience with the cobbler, it's definitely worth asking them to take a look at your boots too. They'll likely be able to assess the loose buckle and give you a quote for the repair.

It's also a good idea to establish a relationship with a reliable cobbler, as they can help you maintain and extend the life of your shoes. Plus, they might be able to offer valuable advice on how to care for your shoes and prevent future issues.

By the way, it's impressive that you keep track of the dates you take your shoes to the cobbler and when you pick them up! You must be very organized.

Do you have a special system for keeping track of your shoes and their maintenance, or is it just something you naturally do?
